title: SpaceX Targets March 14 for Third Starship Test Flight
summary: SpaceX is targeting March 14 for the next Starship Orbital Flight Test pending FAA approval. It will be the third flight of the gigantic rocket in less than a year […]

title: Slingshot Aerospace sets up UK base for global expansion
summary: U.S.-based Slingshot Aerospace is opening offices in the United Kingdom to expand its space traffic coordination and analysis business globally.

title: After Astra loses 99 percent of its value, founders take rocket firm private
summary: First you burn the cash, then comes the crash.

title: Space company Astra going private to avoid bankruptcy after dismal public run
summary: Space company Astra will go private in a cut-rate deal with its founders after a dismal run as a publicly-traded stock.

title: Astra agrees to go private
summary: Spacecraft propulsion and launch company Astra Space has accepted a proposal from its founders to take the company private after previously warning its only other alternative was bankruptcy.

title: Senate Passes Another Extension for the FAA and the “Learning Period”
summary: The Senate passed the Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2024 yesterday to keep the FAA authorized for another two months instead of expiring tomorrow. The bill also extends the […]

title: Stoke Space continues to test reusable second stage, looks ahead to full rocket
summary: Stoke Space recently carried out the first test of the full-size 30-thruster version of the innovative engine that the company is producing for its in-development second stage. This will be an integral part of its future Nova rocket, which aims to be a fully reusable medium lifter.

title: Office of Space Commerce considers restoring orbital debris regulations for commercial remote sensing licensees
summary: The Commerce Department office that licenses commercial remote sensing systems is studying whether it should close a potential loophole in how companies comply with orbital debris mitigation rules.

title: Investing in Space: The evolving market for airline Wi-Fi via satellites
summary: Satellite companies providing internet service to commercial airlines is one of the most mish-mashed sub-sectors of the space industry that I’ve come across over the years.

title: Starship Eyes Mid-March for Flight 3
summary: SpaceX has begun the final prep work for a third flight of their Starship heavy lift reusable launch vehicle, with March 14 as the currently projected liftoff date, pending approval from the Federal Aviation Administration. The mission aims to demonstrate a number of key objectives for the program, including relighting Raptor engines in space and early payload deployment functionality.
